contact.contactName: Toronto and East York Community Council

noticeDescription: Take notice that the Council of the City of Toronto has passed By-law 1174-2020 to designate 2100 Yonge Street (including the entrance addresses at 2102 and 2104 Yonge Street and 8 and 12 Manor Road West) (Toronto-St. Paul's, Ward 12) as being of cultural heritage value or interest.

otherReferenceList.description: 2020.TE19.13 - Inclusion on the City of Toronto's Heritage Register, Intention to Designate under Part IV, Section 29 of the Ontario Heritage Act, Alterations to Designated Heritage Properties, and Authority to Enter into a Heritage Easement Agreement - 2100 and 2106 Yonge Street

By-Law 1174-2020 - To designate the property at 2100 Yonge Street (including the entrance addresses at 2102 and 2104 Yonge Street and 8 and 12 Manor Road West) as being of cultural heritage value or interest.

By-Law 1174-2020 - To designate the property at 2100 Yonge Street (including the entrance addresses at 2102 and 2104 Yonge Street and 8 and 12 Manor Road West) as being of cultural heritage value or interest.

signedBy: John D. Elvidge, Interim City Clerk
subheading: In the Matter of the Ontario Heritage Act R.S.O. 1990 Chapter 0.18 and 2100 Yonge Street (including the entrance addresses at 2102 and 2104 Yonge Street and 8 and 12 Manor Road West), City of Toronto, Province of Ontario
title: Notice of Passing of By-law 1174-2020 - 2100 Yonge Street (including the entrance addresses at 2102 and 2104 Yonge Street and 8 and 12 Manor Road West)
topics: Heritage > Designation of a heritage property
